pros: Positive and fast paced work environment
coworkers, patients, all the therapists really care about providing quality care to patients
cons: administration does not really care much about their staff

pros: Good way to get experience if you want to go to further education
cons: Could get hectic and often felt disorganized

job_title: Physical Therapist Assistant in Honolulu, HI
pros: Great environment to collaborate and gain experience with a variety of pts.
cons: Poor pay, insulting raises every 2-3 years. Mid management is burnt out possible due to high turn over rate. Mid Management (Therapy Dept.) also creates a stressful environment of “private meetings” and micro management. The don’t encourage questions or thinking outside their box.

pros: Great health benefits and 401k. Helpful employees.
cons: The hours. They offer only 8 hour shifts 5 days a week rather than 12 hours shifts. Very strict on over time. Census decrease means potential lay off for employees.

job_title: IT Staff Member in Honolulu, HI
pros: Physical Therapists and staff on the floor care about their patients and that is very evident.
cons: The IT Leader (as of 2020) needs to be evaluated by people NOT on the executive team or HR as he is not a leader type person. Good leaders listen to their employees, not dictate. An entire Infrastructure team departs in his wake and not a single eye brow is raised within the executive team? Perhaps an evaluation by others outside Executives such as the Board of Directors should be done.

pros: good work environment and positive coworkers
cons: not payed enough for amount of work done

review_title: Great Job but Admin needs changes
job_title: Staff Occupational Therapist in Honolulu, HI
pros: friendly co-workers, great learning environment, team attitude
cons: admin doesn't really care about their employees or patients, it's all about the bottom line which is really sad for a non-profit hospital. they did not handle COVID-related issues in an open, timely manner with their employees

review_title: The Rehab Hospital of the Pacific
job_title: Safety Services Department Supervisor in Honolulu, HI
pros: Working in rehab/healthcare allows one to appreciate what healthcare workers really do and the lasting impact on our patients lives.  The aloha spirit lives in the hallways of this hospital, in a low stress work environment.
cons:
Communication between management and employees need major improvement. To change the non-communication culture, we need to change different components simultaneously. For instance, company policy education is not espoused because our organization does not reinforce it or announce change. When a policy is amended, we should bracket and date the policy update or amendment sentence or paragraph, and email blast the change to every employee. When the change is read, the employee clicks an acknowledgement button, telling us they have read the policy change. Right now there is no systems in place. 

Secondly, supervisors/managers need to meet at least weekly with their subordinates and share important information that comes out of the leadership meeting.  The leadership meeting I believe is quarterly and should be monthly to share changes and events that are upcoming to our valued employees.

STREAMLINING THE ORGANIZATION: The organization is fractured and has no rhyme or reason for what it does. For instance lets take ADP and Health stream username. Why do we have 5 different usernames for different software when we should be using our EMPLOYEE NUMBERS. Make use of the employee identification number for username instead of 5 different benjamin.mahi etc.

job_title: Senior Server Administrator in Honolulu, HI
pros: Great people to work with! Environment was overall laid back as long as the work was done.
cons: Some issues with management, but you run into that at most places.

pros: People are great! Make you feel like ohana. Benefits
cons: I didn’t find them. I enjoyed my time there

pros: Compassionate staff including the therapy department, physiatrists and other providers, administration, pharmacists, nursing assistants, housekeeping department, supervisors, human resources, risk management/compliance officers, the DON, Wound Care Specialist,  licensed nursing staff.  The gift shop is a convenient place to purchase not only gifts but also devices and supplies for inpatients and patient discharge.  I have been a nurse there for approximately six years and thank God everyday for the experiences that I have had.  I feel so grateful to be touched and allowed to share in their experiences.  It is really an honor.  Patients have written me cards and also returned to visit me, and it is the most rewarding, intangible experience there is.
cons: Like everywhere there is always room for improvement, but the facility is moving forward so that it's internal beauty matches the physical grounds and beauty.

pros: I’ve worked at other hospitals in Hawaii and on the mainland, and I love that REHAB is just the right size where you have a good patient:staff ratio and you get to know your fellow workers regardless of what department. Staff are warm, friendly and helpful.
cons: In a way this is good, yet the amount of technology changes is overwhelming.  There is minimal training and support. It’s tough for staff who aren’t comfortable with tech, especially when there’s so much to learn all at the same time.

pros: It was a great place to work but most of the staff have left. There still is not a regular FT OT in the outpatient dept & pts are not being seen on a timely basis
cons: Poor support from upper management. Let go all experienced staff & all new grads & little-experienced therapists. Poor scheduling & they don't call for appointments.
no communication from mgmt. no appreciation/advise/suggestion/evaluation even though policy said yearly evaluation. Hence, no promotion, no raise, left hanging on your own

job_title: Staff Occupational Therapist in Honolulu, HI
pros: Good experience, train/orient you well and ease you into your caseload
cons: Very exhausting to work, high turnover, some favoritism
